alert.note: Alert for Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 3:54AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following county, Noble. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 354 AM EST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dudley, Dexter City and Harriettsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
